summary: This bill, the 'Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2025,' amends the 1998 Act to address and mitigate harmful algal blooms (HABs) and hypoxia in US waters. It mandates a 5-year action strategy, focusing on assessment, research prioritization, and coordination among agencies. Key changes include updated definitions, enhanced NOAA and EPA activities, and the establishment of a national-level incubator program to develop new technologies and strategies. The bill also authorizes appropriations for research and mitigation efforts, including grants and cooperative agreements.
